summary: Beth Anne Lichtenfels was a Document Control Clerk for the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is mentioned in several payroll certifications and reports from 1977 to 1979. These documents detail her position, salary, and employment status within the committee. One document specifically pertains to her payroll records, including authorizations, memos, and injury reports. Her involvement appears to be primarily administrative, focused on document management and payroll within the HSCA.
significance: Beth Anne Lichtenfels' significance in the JFK assassination context is related to her role as a Document Control Clerk for the HSCA. While not directly involved in the investigation itself, her position suggests she had access to and managed documents related to the assassination investigation. Her payroll records provide insight into the staffing and administrative operations of the HSCA.
